<title level="1" right="Spell 6" pfs="Standard">
[Vampiric Exsanguination](/Spells.aspx?ID=1735)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=32" />
<trait label="Death" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=40" />
<trait label="Manipulate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=104" />
<trait label="Void" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=510" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=216) pg. 365 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Occult](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=3)

**Bloodline**
[Undead](/Bloodlines.aspx?ID=28)

<row gap="medium">

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Area** 30-foot cone

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Defense**
[basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude

</row>

</column>

---

You draw in the blood and life force of other creatures through your outstretched arms. You deal 12d6 void damage to living creatures in the area with a basic Fortitude save.

 You gain temporary Hit Points equal to half the damage a single creature takes from this spell; calculate these temporary Hit Points using the creature that took the most damage. You lose any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The damage increases by 2d6.
name: Vampiric Exsanguination
